column2: UTAH DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column10: Answer4 Text

column2: 1. Worn tires:
column4: may cause you to hydroplane even with very little water on the road.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column10: Truck stop ahead

column2: 3. When the pavement is marked with a double yellow line, drivers may pass other vehicles:
column4: only if the vehicle ahead is driving 10 mph or more under the speed limit.
column8: None of the other answers is correct.
column10: only if there are no oncoming vehicles.

column2: 4. Which shape is a warning sign?
column10: Pennant

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: All traffic must turn right at next intersection
column10: Right turn on red light permitted

column2: 6. If a vehicle is approaching with high beams, drivers should look __________ until the vehicle passes.
column4: at the center of the road
column8: to the right of the road
column10: to the left of the road

column2: 7. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column6: you cannot see without moving your head.
column8: you see in your side mirror.
column10: you see in your rearview mirror.

column2: 8. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column6: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 9. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: passing is permitted in either direction.
column6: the lane to the left may pass.
column8: passing is not permitted in either direction.
column10: the lane to the right may pass.

column2: 10. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control
column6: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.
column8: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.
column10: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.

column2: 11. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:
column4: stop first, then gradually enter traffic.
column6: accelerate to the speed of traffic.
column8: enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.
column10: drive above the speed of traffic to get ahead.

column2: 12. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column6: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.
column10: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.

column2: 13. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column10: vehicles from the right.

column2: 14. Bicyclists must:
column4: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column6: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column8: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column10: remain near the left edge of the road.

column2: 15. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
column10: Rectangle

column2: 16. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column6: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column8: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column10: None of the above.

column2: 17. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column10: Warning signs (diamond)

column2: 18. Before turning left, it is important to:
column4: flash your headlights to alert the other drivers.
column8: swing to the right side of your lane.
column10: sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 19. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column8: only if the traffic signal turns red.
column10: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 20. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column10: of a reduction of lanes

column2: 21. This sign means:
column10: Wrong way; Turn around immediately.

column2: 22. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: exceed the posted speed limit when driving on expressways.
column8: share the lane with another vehicle.
column10: ride side-by-side in a single lane.

column2: 23. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column10: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.

column2: 24. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column10: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 25. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column6: Eating before or while you drink.
column10: Not drinking over a period of time.
